ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The french curriculum at Yale is unlike any other language curriculum I have experienced, in the most positive way possible. It is an immersive course without actual immersion in the country or culture of the language and the areas focused on are definitely more beneficial than if we were to learn a list of numbers, colours or animals. I think I have become quite eloquent in a very short amount of time.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course is notoriously challenging but I don't think the students who choose to take it are discouraged by that. My professor was very understanding and supportive of everyones struggle in the class and the unity of the challenge made the learning environment extremely welcoming, despite having no idea what the answer was to a question the professor asked at times. I think the way this course is set out and instructed is wonderful, and that is clear because their method has worked for many years thus far.

I would like more opportunities to practice having real conversations.

Answering questions and going through the videos is fun but I want to simulate meeting a friend for coffee or asking about their weekend.

This course is an awesome intensive on the French language. I learned a lot of important foundational grammar that will carry me through my continued study of french at Yale and beyond.  I wish there had been more conversation simulations and speaking practice, though.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would definitely recommend this class as I thoroughly enjoyed starting out my day with a pleasant professor and some language learning.
Yes!!! Prof Ngame is a gem and French is a beautiful language. You improve so quickly in L2.
Yes! A fun and quick way to learn French.
Yes, if they want to learn foundational French.
Yes. I loved everything from the professor to the lessons and my fellow students
